page.title: 06ENERGY USED IN KNOYDART.
page.content: THE MAIN FORMS OF ENERGY USED ARE HYDRO ELECTRICITY,COAL,PEAT AND WOOD. {HYDRO ELECTRICITY }THERE IS A PRIVATE HYDRO ELECTRIC SCHEME WHICH MAKES USE OF THE HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE AREA.THE WATER IS STORED IN LOCH BRAOMISAIG. {COAL}THIS IS BROUGHT FROM MALLAIG ON THE "SPANISH JOHN" ONLY ONCE PER YEAR. {PEAT}MANY FAMILIES IN SPRING GO TO THE PEAT HAGS TO CUT SUFFICIENT PEAT FOR A YEAR.THIS IS LEFT TO DRY OUT AND THEN CARRIED HOME FOR LATER USE. {WOOD}THIS IS ALSO USED AS FUEL.THE MEN OF THE VILLAGE CUT THE FALLEN WOOD OR IT CAN BE PURCHASED FROM THE MILL. MOST HOUSES HAVE SOLID FUEL STOVES WHICH FROM ONE ENERGY SOURCE PROVIDE HEATING,COOKING AND HOT WATER.
